snippet: The 86-day course — which meets four times a year — is called the corps’ most grueling school by its instructors and is intended to screen and train potential infantry officers.
abstract: Marine Corps will begin allowing women to participate in its grueling Infantry Officer Course, an 86-day course designed to screen and train potential infantry officers; integration is part of a larger study to gauge the feasibility of allowing female Marines to serve in more extensive combat roles.
